author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: آءِ وَثَنَائَكَ عِنْدَ هُبُوبِ أَرْياحِ القَضآءِ، وَأَنْتَ تَعْلَمُ يا إِلهِي بِأَنَّ البَهآءَ لا يَجْزَعُ عَمَّا وَرَدَ عَلَيْهِ فِي سَبِيلِكَ بَلْ أَجِدُ كُلَّ أَعْضَائِي وَجَوارِحِي يَشْتاقُ البَلآءَ لإِظْهارِ أَمْرِكَ يا مالِكَ الأَسْماءِ، مِنْ ماءِ حُبِّكَ اسْتَبْقَى البَهآءُ فِي مَلَكُوتِ الإِنْشآءِ، وَمِنْ نَارِ ذِكْرِكَ اشْتَعَلَ البَهآءُ بَيْنَ الأَرْضِ وَالسَّمآءِ، طُوبى لِي وَلِهذِهِ النَّارِ الَّتِيْ تُسْمَعُ مِنْ زَفِيرِها لا إِلهَ إِلاَّ
translation: How sweet is the thought of Thee in times of adversity and trial, and how delightful to glorify Thee when compassed about with the fierce winds of Thy decree! Thou knowest full well, O my God, that I endure patiently whatsoever toucheth me in Thy path. Nay, I perceive that all the members and limbs of my body long for tribulation, that I may manifest Thy Cause, O Thou Who art the Lord of all names! The waters of Thy love have preserved me in the kingdom of Thy creation, and the fire of my remembrance of Thee hath set me ablaze before all that are in heaven and on earth. Great is my blessedness, and great the blessedness of this fire whose flame crieth out: “No God is there save Thee, Who art the Object of my heart’s adoration, and the Source and Center of my soul!”
